alert.note: Alert for Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:08PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible along Little Last Chance Creek. * WHERE...A portion of northeast California, including the following county, Plumas. * WHEN...Until 300 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.8 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Vinton, CA-70, Chilcoot Campground, and Spring Creek Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
